title: Ticket #2220: DAGMan should deal better with warnings from condor_submit
description:
Bill ran into some errors like this today: 

  06/09/11 02:07:47 Submitting Condor Node dataset_human2-human_tf.txt_495+dataset_human2-human_tf.txt_495 job(s)...
  06/09/11 02:07:47 submitting: condor_submit -a dag_node_name' '=' 'dataset_human2-human_tf.txt_495+dataset_human2-human_tf.txt_495 -a +DAGManJobId' '=' '2848192 -a DAGManJobId' '=' '2848192 -a submit_event_notes' '=' 'DAG' 'Node:' 'dataset_human2-human_tf.txt_495+dataset_human2-human_tf.txt_495 -a +DAGParentNodeNames' '=' '"" process.cmd
  06/09/11 02:07:50 From submit: Submitting job(s).
  06/09/11 02:07:50 From submit: 1 job(s) submitted to cluster 2867569.
  06/09/11 02:09:19 From submit:
  06/09/11 02:09:19 From submit: WARNING: File /spalding/imageruns4/home/SOAR/html/condorruns/TFcluster/1734/dataset_human2-human_tf.txt_495/../sharedfiles.tar.gz is not readable by condor.
  06/09/11 02:09:24 ERROR: parse_condor_submit failed:
        WARNING: File /spalding/imageruns4/home/SOAR/html/condorruns/TFcluster/1734/dataset_human2-human_tf.txt_495/../sharedfiles.tar.gz is not readable by condor.

I have to confirm this, but it looks like the condor_submit actually works, and DAGMan gets confused by the warning, and thinks it didn't. This ends up causing DAGMan to re-submit the job; and then it eventually ended up with this error: 

  06/09/11 02:09:30 ERROR: node dataset_human2-human_tf.txt_495+dataset_human2-human_tf.txt_495: job ID in userlog submit event (2867569.0.0) doesn't match ID reported earlier by submit command (2867570.0.0)!  Aborting DAG; set DAGMAN_ABORT_ON_SCARY_SUBMIT to false if you are *sure* this shouldn't cause an abort.
remarks: This looks like a dup of #3658
creator: wenger
